The claim is based on a false theory pro: who believe that President Trump secretly watermarked mail-in ballots to expose Democratic voter fraud.
The theory is supported by a YouTube vid: pointing to small specks on her ballot strip as evidence.
Fact: checking organizations, such as FactCheck.org and Reuters, have debunked the claim, highlighting that there is no evidence of watermarked ballots or premarked ballots with non-radioactive isotope watermarks.
Chris Krebs: the director of the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency, has publicly refuted the claim on Twitter, stating that the Department of Homeland Security and CISA do not design or audit ballots.
